pull.title: refactoring: Use direct list initialization for Arg struct
pull.body:
Using a direct list initialization for `struct Arg` objects makes the constructor needless.

This PR has been split out from #16097 (see: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16097#issuecomment-514487370).

issue.title: Refactor: Add Flags enum to ArgsManager class
issue.body:
This PR adds the `Flags` enum to the `ArgsManager` class. Also the `m_flags` member is added to the `Arg` struct. Flags denote an allowed type of an arg value and special hints.

This PR is only a refactoring and does not change behavior.

comments.body: Can't test at the moment but I think you could drop `Arg`?

> Can't test at the moment but I think you could drop `Arg`?

It won't work if a type is automatically deduced: `auto ret = ...`
Can those be const to enforce setting them in the constructor?
I'd prefer to keep it. Three ascii chars are not a bloat
